Half-Life: Blue Shift is the second and final expansion to Half-Life. Despite that, I played it before the first expansion, Half-Life: Opposing Force. This is because I heard that Opposing Force was superior and playing it first would make Blue Shift feel underwhelming in comparison. Blue Shift was a short, painless experience but somewhat dull. As for game-play, the level design was still interesting and it still had some interesting areas of the Black Mesa research facility to show you. The annoying platforming aspects in the base game were absent and the puzzles, while there were few of them and none were quite complex, were enjoyable and satisfying to solve. The game obviously retains the same gun-play from Half-Life but, sadly, unlike Opposing Force, no new weapons are added to your arsenal. You just get the base game weapons and even then you don't even get all of them. While some weapons did have lore reasons not to be in your arsenal, some are inexcusably absent. As for the narrative, aside from the intro, which I thought did the original game's intro justice, the narrative of Blue Shift, the very thing that made Half-Life worth playing in 2021, paled in comparison to the base game's. The narrative was forced upon you, not allowing you to kill essentially anyone you'd like, making certain NPCs essential in the narrative. It's a step down from the original Half-Life but I wouldn't mind it as much if the narrative was just as good as the original. Unfortunately, it's quite dull. The plot is simply to escape the aforementioned Black Mesa research facility and lacks the complex morale questions brought up by the first game that made it worth playing.
In conclusion, Blue Shift, as stated before, is short and painless. You can beat it in one sitting and there's definitely fun to be had. However, unlike the base game, nothing in Blue Shift will leave much of an impact on you. Blue Shift is simply more Half-Life and not much else. But that may not be a bad thing.
Neat!
good

[h1]Half-Life: Blue Shift[/h1]
SciFi Action von 2001.

Urspr√ºnglich als Add-on zu Half-Life, ist es nun ein eigenst√§ndiges Spiel. Gespielt wird wieder in der Black Mesa Research Facility. 
Du schl√ºpfst in die Rolle von Barney Calhoun, dem netten Wachmann, der Gordon aus so mancher verzwickter Lage geholfen hat. Und das ist echt gut gelungen. 

Es hat ein ‚ÄûHigh Definition Pack‚Äú genanntes Upgrade, das mit neuen Texturen versehen ist. In der deutschen Version sind die Gegner Roboter anstatt Soldaten. Der deutschen Zensur sei es verdankt, aber seit 2017 kannst du es auch im Original spielen.
Der mehrdeutige Name ‚ÄûBlue Shift‚Äú, zu deutsch etwa Blaue Dienstschicht (weil die Sicherheitskr√§fte blau gekleidet sind) oder Blauverschiebung, spielt auf das physikalische Ph√§nomen der Blauverschiebung an. Aber das nur so am Rande als Hintergrundwissen.

Du beginnst deinen Arbeitstag in Black Mesa. Vielleicht sollte ich besser sagen du versuchst ihn zu beginnen. Denn die Technik der gesamten Anlage funktioniert nur fehlerhaft. Nachdem du es in die Anlage geschafft hast begibst du dich sogleich zu einem Fahrstuhl.
Bekanntlich ist die Anlage tief in den Fels gebaut. Mitten in der Fahrt jedoch geht das Experiment unter Beteiligung von Freeman schief, Aliens tauchen in der Anlage auf... n√∂, weiter erz√§hle ich nicht.
Also mach dich auf und finde selbst heraus was da los ist.
Genial gemachtes sehr witziges FPS, mit Tiefgang.

[h1] Half-Life: Blue Shift [/h1]
SciFi Action from 2001.

Originally an add-on to Half-Life, it is now a standalone game. Again, the game will be played in the Black Mesa Research Facility.
You slip into the role of Barney Calhoun, the nice security guard who helped Gordon out of many a tricky situation. And that turned out really well.

It has an upgrade called "High Definition Pack" that has new textures. In the German version, the opponents are robots instead of soldiers. It was thanks to the German censorship, but since 2017 you can also play it in the original.
The ambiguous name "Blue Shift", in German about blue shift (because the security forces are dressed in blue) or blue shift, alludes to the physical phenomenon of blue shift. But that's just as background knowledge.

You start your work day at Black Mesa. Maybe I'd better say you try to start it. Because the technology of the entire system only works incorrectly. After you have made it into the facility, you immediately go to an elevator.
As is well known, the system is built deep into the rock. In the middle of the journey, however, the experiment with Freeman involved goes wrong, aliens appear in the facility ... nope, I won't tell any further.
So get up and find out for yourself what's going on.
Ingeniously made, very funny FPS, with depth.
 
My group and my archive with over 2,250 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

This is a fun expansion, but Opposing Force is kinda better tbh,,,

It's not as well made (ex. player model is literally Gordon but with Barney arms, the title screen is just blue with the half life logo), it's short af being only a couple hours long, not as many weapons, and doesn't include Deathmatch for whatever reason.

But it does add cool unique quirks and, other than Opposing Force's ending, more relevant lore than Opposing Force. 

I like Barney alot more as a character than Adrian, due to the fact I played Half Life 2 before this. Imo Valve/Gearbox could've did better with Barney's game, but this is still a fun game for Half Life fans.
Its a buggy game but what do you expect its from 2001. The story is great and I would love to replay it again but for new players don't save at the end it might exit you out of the game.

Todav√≠a no he jugado el Decay, pero puedo decir que esta es la experiencia m√°s express de los Half Lives de los 90s. Est√° muy bueno y es muy interesante c√≥mo lo unen con el juego original. Despu√©s, el juego termina siendo bastante corto y, para m√≠, no llega al nivel al que el Opposing Force llega, ya que no trae nuevos a√±adidos. Sin embargo, debo admitir que compensa esa carencia con una trama mucho m√°s profunda, de la cual el Opposing Force carec√≠a enormemente. Sin dudas, es una experiencia memorable donde, si el Opposing Force ten√≠a problemas con el dise√±o de niveles al tornarse muy tediosos, este juego muestra casi que el lado opuesto y se siente incluso f√°cil, aunque dando un poco m√°s de fortaleza al enriquecimiento del entorno al no distraer al jugador con tanto combate. En conclusi√≥n, es un juego muy interesante para todos quienes quieran adentrarse al 100% en el mundo de Half Life.

[h1][b]Short but Sweet[/b][/h1]
The game is definitely short but good, this game discovers a new different way to escape the Black Mesa Research Facility than Opposing Force or the original Half-Life as an officer named "Barney Calhoun". For being only about 3 hours, the game feels longer and is able to pack in as much action and problem solving as the other two. It's a short, but good adventure through Black Mesa and I highly recommend it.

A short and sweet adition to the first Half Life, obviously there isnt as much action and the action is much less intense, but that is to be expected, this isnt Freeman or a trained soldier, just a guard working at Black Mesa, it was enjoyable seeing the events at the site througha different POV and unlike in the original game the levels were easier to navigate through and the puzzles more intuitive. Overall a worthwhile DLC.

A short, sweet and simple Half Life game, detailing Barney's escape from Black Mesa.
I really liked the fact that Barney cannot use an HEV, so he has to pick up individual pieces of Armor for extra protection.
Although not as impressive as Opposing Force, the attempt by Gearbox was fair to let it be a nice expansion pack. Everything from shooting to enemies is the same, excepts maybe the ending which was a bit surprising.

Al igual que como opino del primer DLC, es un buen juego, con muy buenas mec√°nicas, historia, narrativa y un personaje particularmente interesante (que no es el protagonista), y finalmente obtenemos un final para nada abierto y feliz, siempre y cuando no sepas lo que pasa despu√©s ;). Lo que tengo que decir sobre este juego es b√°sicamente que aunque no ofrezca una experiencia tan larga como el anterior (por lo cual creo que deber√≠an bajarle el precio, tambi√©n puede ser que tras jugar el juego principal el primer DLC haya adquirido algo de habilidad, qui√©n sabe ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø ) sigue siendo un buen DLC que te alarga algo la magn√≠fica experiencia que te dan tanto el juego como el primer DLC, con unos cuantos gui√±os a estos por cierto, sobre todo al principio y al final ;).
